content: The Act titled "Promoting Access to Medicare Midwifery Services Act of 2000" includes a table of contents outlining the sections of the Act. The "Promoting Access to Medicare Midwifery Services Act of 2000" includes provisions for Medicare payment for certified midwife services, increased payments for certified nurse-midwife services, clarification of hospital conditions for midwives, payment for birth center services, billing rights clarification, and regulations. The "Promoting Access to Medicare Midwifery Services Act of 2000" amends the Social Security Act to define certified midwife services as those provided by a certified midwife and includes services and supplies incident to the midwife's service authorized by state law. Medicare payments for certified nurse-midwife and certified midwife services increased to 95 percent of the prevailing charge. Effective for services furnished on or after the date of enactment of this Act. Payment to Hospital for Patients Under Care of Certified Nurse-Midwife or Certified Midwife is amended to allow patients to be under the care of a certified nurse-midwife or certified midwife for services as permitted by State law. The amendment allows patients to be under the care of a certified nurse-midwife or certified midwife for services as permitted by State law, effective upon enactment of the Act. Medicare payment for freestanding birth center services. Medicare payment for freestanding birth center services is defined as items and services provided by a freestanding birth center, which is a facility where planned births occur outside the mother's residence, comprehensive health care services are offered, and it is approved or accredited by the Secretary. The text discusses the exclusion of certain facilities from the definition of freestanding birth centers for accreditation purposes and amends the scope of benefits under the Social Security Act for freestanding birth centers. The text discusses amending the Social Security Act to include payment for freestanding birth center services, with conditions for full payment acceptance and assignment agreement with the Secretary. The Secretary will establish payment amounts for facility services in freestanding birth centers under this title. The amendment allows for certified nurse-midwives and certified midwives to provide obstetrics and gynecology services in teaching hospitals, with payment authorized under the Social Security Act. Certified nurse-midwives and certified midwives in teaching hospitals agree not to bill charges for professional services to individuals covered under the insurance program established by this title. The Secretary of Health and Human Services may issue interim regulations to implement amendments in a timely manner, except for those made by section 7(b), within 1 year of the enactment of this Act.
